intro: Leontodon chionophilus, commonly known as the snow-loving dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, dark green leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in cold, alpine environments and is adapted to withstand harsh winter conditions. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Leontodon chionophilus is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that demonstrates resilience in high-altitude habitats.
